snippet.title: Johnny Depp asked to stand down from Fantastic Beasts after losing ‘wife beater’ libel case
snippet.description:
Subscribe to the Evening Standard on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC7RQon_YwCnp_LbPtEwW65w?sub_confirmation=1

Hollywood star Johnny Depp has been booted off the Fantastic Beasts film franchise after he was branded a “wife beater” in the High Court this week. 

A judge found on Monday that Depp had repeatedly beaten ex-wife Amber Heard during their five-year romance, punching and headbutting her in bouts of verbal and physical abuse while drunk and on drugs. 

Depp, 57, has vowed to appeal the career-wrecking ruling, but revealed in a social media post today that he is leaving the Harry Potter spin-off series.

“I wish to let you know that I have been asked to resign by Warner Bros. from my role as Grindelwald in Fantastic Beasts and I have respected and agreed to that”, he said in a typed statement shared on Instagram. 

Read more: https://www.standard.co.uk/news/uk/johnny-depp-asked-to-stand-down-from-fantastic-beasts-film-b52612.html
